t: Why*p standest thou afar off, O Lord?*s why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?
The*p wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
For*p the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the Lord*s abhorreth.
The*p wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
His*p ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
He*p hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.
His*p mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.
He*p sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
He*p lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
He*p croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
He*p hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.
Arise,*p O Lord;*s O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.
Wherefore*p doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.
Thou*p hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
Break*p thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.
The*p Lord*s is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.
Lord,*sp thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
To*p judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
